The uniques pallet drags Dotsama into catch-up mode with eth, rather than leapfrogging it with something like @RmrkApp.

Instead of fostering innovation, it forces teams to play a careful political balancing act between choosing the official vs choosing the innovative. https://t.co/YgR49nb5UG

An Exosama riding a tiger on MOVR should be able to ride it in full into @KaruraNetwork to collateralize the animal and take out a loan against it.

https://t.co/Meir2h4kz9

If you move a Kanaria with a hat, we expect you to get both the Kanaria and the hat on the destination chain.

If you move a song that is multi resourced to also have a music video and a note sheet PDF, we expect you to get it whole when you move it. https://t.co/6U33T4jR5F

This means your multi-resource, nested, equippable, reactive NFTs become dumbed down single-image representations of themselves when you move them around.

This is not what we want.

RMRK is about seamless teleportation of non-fungibles across chains. FULL non fungible assets. https://t.co/VBcvHJ0P9S

One of the fundamental building blocks of RMRK, the core of our very core pallet, is multi-resource and nested NFTs.

By using this XCM format, which only caters for the most basic of NFTs (links to media) as present on Statemine (see https://t.co/pNY07Gd74R), we lose this info.

To clarify why this has no effect on us, since my DMs are full of confused emoji.
